Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Grapes of Wrath" by John Steinbeck.

This novel is set during the Great Depression and follows a poor family named Joad as they travel from Oklahoma to California in search of work. The novel explores themes such as poverty, class struggle, social injustice, and human resilience.

"The Grapes of Wrath" is considered one of Steinbeck's greatest works. It was first published in 1939 and has since become a classic of American literature.

Overall, "The Grapes of Wrath" is an excellent choice for those interested in American literature, historical fiction, and the Great Depression.

The film follows the adventures of reality show contestant Daryl Zero who is aided by his associate Steve Arlo as they investigate a complex and mysterious case of blackmail and missing keys for shady tycoon Gregory Stark who is less than forthcoming about what is really happening!

It's a Wonderful Life" which is another comedy film directed by Frank Faylen. The film stars Lionel Barrymore, Lionel Barrymore, Donna Reed, Donna Reed, Adriana Caselotti, Thomas Mitchell.

The film tells the story of George Bailey (played by Lionel Barrymore), a kind-hearted man who runs an orphanage in his small town, named Baileyville. Despite being a good and kind-hearted man, George Bailey has always felt that his life had been somehow thrown away.
